intro: Crassula obfalcata, commonly known as the Jade Plant or Money Plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically oval or egg-shaped, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red during the spring. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems. Crassula obfalcata is popular as a houseplant due to its low maintenance and attractive appearance.
